Posts.Content: On 4/28/2007 Marilli wrote: Hi - I am looking for someone that has had an organ transpant and ended up with any type of cancer.  I am a male with metastatic breast cancer.  I never had chemo due to having a suppressed immune system.  Is there anyone that has had a transplant of any kind and ended with up with cancer and did chemotherapy?  Am wondering how this affected your immune system and what type of chemo did you have.  Any information is appreciated.  Thank you.   Hi, I am a kidney transplant patient.  I had Thyroid cancer and radio-iodine therapy and now have a breast lump and waiting diagnosis.  So, I have not had the traditional chemo...yet.  But thought I would introduce myself because I think we are a rare breed.  Us lucky folks with less than perfect immune systems to fight cancer.  This is my second transplant and I am chronically rejecting it too.  I was diagnosed with a blood proliferative disorder in early 2000 which is also raising its ugly head these days.  This disease can turn to Leukemia.   I have a high white and platlet blood count.  My doctor at NIH in Bethesda Maryland is currently doing research on transplanted organs without immunesurpression.  The sad thing for us is that while we do not die from our original organ failure disease, we probably will get cancer.  My prayers are with you my friend.   JCSFree
Posts.Title: Liver Transplant and Metastatic Breast Cancer
